itemDescription: South African engineering academic in the UK

wikipedia_page.main: John Boscawen Burland  (born 4 March 1936) is an Emeritus Professor and Senior Research Investigator at the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering of Imperial College London.In 2016, Burland was elected as a member into the National Academy of Engineering for contributions to geotechnical engineering and the design, construction, and preservation of civil infrastructure and heritage buildings.

response: *John Burland, Professor of Soil Mechanics, Imperial College London. Well known for stabilising The Leaning Tower of Pisa
* "A tale of Two Towers: Big Ben and Pisa"—transcript of a lecture by Prof. John Burland
* John Burland, C.B.E., engineer and researcher,
